item.title: Company announcement template: revenue mix
item.description: Mix Suzuki generated operating profit of US$2 billion from sales of US$32 billion in FY19 for a year on year decline of 34%. Management attributes the fall in revenue in FY19 to the slow down in India’s economy, the relative strength of the JPY to other currencies, and, the Coronavirus lock downs. The composition of Suzuki’s revenue and operating profit show clearly that car manufacturing is the core business for the group.

item.title: Company results template: balance sheet
item.description: Balance sheet secure Even though there was a draw down of cash during the year Suzuki’s balance sheet remains strong with ending net cash and securities of JPY1677 billion or US$15 billion equivalent to JPY3,579/share. In light of ongoing uncertainties in the durability of future demand management has flagged that it intends to continue to strengthen the balance sheet. ## Item FY2019 FY2018 pct abschange ## 34 debt 404193 375437 7.

item.title: Company results template: headline numbers
item.description: Headine figures Suzuki announced a 10% reduction in net sales for the year to JPY 3488 billion or US$32.4 billion. Operating income fell 34% to JPY 215 billion or US$2 billion. Earnings per share declined 28% to JPY286/share. Despite the reported decline registered and further weakness projected ahead the company balance sheet remains strong and management declared a special dividend. ## Item FY2019 FY2018 pct abschange ## 1 net_sales 3488433.

item.title: Company results template: initial financial prep
item.description: Financials Suzuki Motors (7269.T, JPY3700) announced year end FY2019 (April 2019 through March 2020) results that show a decline in net sales and earnings. In the following articles will examine. headline earnings; revenue and operating profit mix; balance sheet position; cash flow generation and use; ratio analysis; consensus earnings outlook; valuation. But for now will assemble input data that will then wrangle into a form suitable for future analysis and presentation.

item.title: Company results template: share price
item.description: Purpose Thought process and actions steps following on earnings announcement. The example am using is the fourth quarter results posted by Suzuki Motors (7269.T, JPY3700) for period ended 2020-03-31. Recent price performance Recent price analysis versus benchmarks show the shares of Suzuki remain 26% below the peak in the year and below that of the Nikkei and Dow Jones. ## # A tibble: 3 x 6 ## # Groups: symbol [3] ## symbol company curr_price min_price max_price pctchange_from_max ## <fct> <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 ^N225 N225 Index 21419.

item.title: Moving grains - dry bulk
item.description: Conclusion initial examination of one balance sheet item for dry goods shipping sector shows that most companies carry a reasonably high debt load. GNK emerges as one of the stronger company balance sheets. SHIP among the weakest. Further analysis on assets and cash flow will follow. Trigger to enquiry The decline in the Baltic Dry Index (BDI) to below 400 caught attention this morning. That level approaches a 25 year low and compares to 1000 in january 2020 and 2500 in september 2019 (representing an 84% decline).
